oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Negative Application Conditions for Reconfigurable Algebraic High-Level Systems
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Rein, Alexander
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: ddc:004
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: This paper introduces negative application conditions for reconfigurable algebraic high-level systems. These are algebraic high-level systems, i.e. algebraic high-level nets with an initial marking, together with a set of rules for changing the system dynamically. Negative application conditions are a control structure for restricting the application of a rule if a certain structure is present. The use of negative application conditions is motivated in a short example. Subsequently, the underlying theory is sketched and the most significant results are presented. Finally, the example is resumed and the main results and their usefulness within the example are discussed.
